name: relacquer
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
to paint wood or metal with a new layer of lacquer (= a liquid that forms a hard, shiny surface when it dries): She decided to relacquer the chairs, rather than throw them out. For a small charge we can re-sand and re-lacquer the table top.
More examplesFewer examplesThe fixtures in the old bathroom were stripped and relacquered.They relacquered the table in silver leaf with a gold overlay.He had a contract to replace and relacquer the furniture.
